text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.

Jobseekers, this one’s for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-up… the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isn’t about you or your skills. It’s about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesn’t acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe. 🌻
Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you’re just left ghosted.

LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn’t even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.

sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?

Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!

Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasn’t nothing. It was the Universe’s way of saying, “Not this one, something better is on the way.”

Every single time, I’ve been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things don’t go as planned, I don’t panic.

I don’t question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you can’t see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.

To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. 💔

Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. 🌸

According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter. 💥

Your mental health matters more than any job.

Sometimes, we forget that a company’s brand name doesn’t define someone’s talent. It’s easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

I’ve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They don’t need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side too—people in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

Let’s stop attaching someone’s value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear this—skills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth don’t come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.

So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good 😯

I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. � 80

If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :(
)

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under 🙏

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)

Just shipped a feature that took 3 months to build. 

The dopamine hit from seeing users actually use it? Priceless. 

This is why I love being a developer. 

Building something from scratch and watching it come to life never gets old.

AI won't replace developers. 

Developers who use AI will replace developers who don't. 

The future belongs to those who adapt, not those who resist change. 

Time to embrace the tools that make us more productive.

Started my own business 2 years ago with just ₹50,000. 

Today we crossed ₹1 crore in revenue. 

Here's what I learned: 
→ Start before you're ready 
→ Focus on solving real problems 
→ Customer feedback is gold 
→ Persistence beats perfection 

The entrepreneurial journey is tough, but incredibly rewarding.

Remote work taught me something important: 

Productivity isn't about being busy. It's about being effective. 

I get more done in 6 focused hours at home than 10 hours in a noisy office. 

The future of work is about results, not hours logged.

Your network is your net worth. 

But here's the thing - networking isn't about collecting contacts. 

It's about building genuine relationships. 

Help others first. The opportunities will follow naturally.

Data doesn't lie, but it can mislead. 

Spent 3 hours today explaining why correlation ≠ causation to stakeholders. 

As data scientists, our job isn't just to crunch numbers. 

It's to tell the right story with the right context.

Marketing budget: ₹10 lakhs 
Result: 50 new customers 

Content marketing budget: ₹50,000 
Result: 500 new customers 

Sometimes the best marketing doesn't feel like marketing at all. 

Value first, selling second.

Design isn't just about making things look pretty. 

It's about solving problems. 

Every color, every font, every button placement has a purpose. 

Good design is invisible - users don't notice it, they just feel it works.

Burnout is real. 

Took a 2-week break after working 70-hour weeks for 6 months. 

Came back more creative, more focused, and more productive. 

Rest isn't a luxury. It's a necessity for peak performance.

Finance tip that changed my life: 

Pay yourself first. 

Before rent, before groceries, before anything - save 20% of your income. 

Automate it so you don't have to think about it. 

Future you will thank present you.

Learning never stops. 

Just completed my 5th online course this year. 

The moment you think you know everything is the moment you become irrelevant. 

Invest in yourself. It's the best ROI you'll ever get.

Sales isn't about convincing people to buy what they don't need. 

It's about helping people realize they need what you're offering. 

Listen more than you talk. 

Understand their pain points. 

Then show how you can solve them.

Startup life in a nutshell: 

6 AM: 'We're going to change the world!' 
6 PM: 'Are we even solving a real problem?' 
11 PM: 'Maybe we should pivot...' 
2 AM: 'Actually, this might work!' 

The emotional rollercoaster is real, but so is the potential.

Diversity isn't just a buzzword. 

Our most innovative solutions came from our most diverse teams. 

Different perspectives lead to different solutions. 

Different solutions lead to breakthrough innovations.

Public speaking used to terrify me. 

Shaking hands, sweaty palms, forgetting my words. 

Today I spoke to 500+ people at a conference. 

The secret? Practice, preparation, and accepting that nervousness is normal. 

Your comfort zone is where dreams go to die.

Company culture isn't ping pong tables and free snacks. 

It's how you treat people when things go wrong. 

It's whether you promote based on merit or politics. 

It's if people feel safe to speak up. 

Culture is what happens when the CEO isn't watching.

Freelancing taught me more about business than my MBA ever did. 

Client management, project scoping, pricing strategies, cash flow - you learn it all by doing. 

The gig economy isn't just a side hustle anymore. 

It's a masterclass in entrepreneurship.

Meditation changed my productivity game. 

10 minutes every morning = 2 hours of better focus throughout the day. 

It's not about emptying your mind. 

It's about training your attention. 

Best investment of time I've ever made.

Climate change isn't someone else's problem. 

It's a business opportunity. 

Sustainable practices don't just help the planet - they reduce costs and attract conscious consumers. 

Green business is good business.

Customer service is everyone's job. 

Not just the support team's. 

Every interaction shapes your brand. 

Every touchpoint is an opportunity to delight or disappoint. 

Make every moment count.
